newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch PTT says now has 93.5 pct of TNT.
newsitem.headline: Dutch PTT says now has 93.5 pct of TNT.

text.p: Dutch post and telecoms group PTT Nederland NV said on Tuesday it was now entitled to 93.5 percent of issued ordinary shares of TNT shares and 85.9 percent of issued converting preference shares.
"KPN (Australia) has now received acceptances from over 12,300 TNT shareholders," PTT said in a statement.
The company declared its A$2 billion bid for transport group TNT unconditional late last month after it received acceptances for more than 50 percent of the issued capital.
KPN had previously said the bid would be unconditional from a level of 90 percent of acceptance. The A$2.45 cash offer for ordinary and preference shares closes on December 12.
